Water Code: LEFT HAND CREEK #2 - GEER CR to LEFT HAND PARK RES
Description: Travel on Lefthand Cyn Dr or US-36 to the jct of Sawmill Rd, Lefthand Cyn Dr and California Gulch Rd (1 mile south of Ward). California Gulch Rd is the unmarked gravel rd leading NW from this jct - follow it 0.9 miles to the end.  Sample site is at the entrance to the Big Five Tunnel, from which the mine drainage water flows.
Eco Region: S Rockies Warm and Dry Forests of the Middle to Lo
Comments:
Volunteer Group:  Lefthand Watershed Oversight Group
Contact:  Glenn Patterson
River:  Left Hand Creek
Station Name:  Big Five Tunnel Drainage
Station Description:  
    Latitude:  40 degrees 03 minutes 48.36 seconds
    Longitude:  105 degrees 30 minutes 43.72 seconds
    Elevation:  8962 feet.
    This is the water draining from the Big Five Tunnel at EPA's Superfund site near Ward, Colorado.  To get to the station you drive on Lefthand Canyon Drive from either Ward or U.S. 36 to the junction, 1 mile south of Ward, where Sawmill Road, Lefthand Canyon Drive, and California Gulch Road come together.  California Gulch Road is the unmarked dirt road leading northwest from this junction.  Follow this road to its end, 0.9 mile from the junction.  The tunnel entrance is the obvious structure from which mine drainage water flows.  Sample at the entrance of the tunnel.
    Nearest town:  Ward, CO.

Water Code: GLACIER CREEK - RMNP, BIG T #5 to THE LOCH
Description: As you are driving into Estes Park from the east, follow US 34 to US 36 (Moraine). Turn left onto US36. After you pass the amusement park on your left, watch for signs to the YMCA of the Rockies. Turn left at the signs for the YMCA onto CO 66. The YMCA is a couple of miles down this road. Turn right into the YMCA of the Rockies entrance. Take the first left turn onto Mt. Side Dr.  From Mt. Side Dr., follow the signs to Moraine Park. You’ll take a right, then a left. Park under the trees just uphill from the barricades blocking the road. The flowing water within 50 meters is Glacier Creek.  Cross the bridge across Glacier Creek. The sampling site is on river left, upstream of the bridge.
Eco Region: S Rockies Cool and Moist Forests of the Middle to
Comments:
YMCA of the Rockies. 6/4/12 - BS updt coords per WQCD review (best guess per DESC).

Water Code: SAND CREEK - S PLATTE R #8, @ Commerce City
Description:
This site is best accessed starting at the Dahlia Trailhead along the Colorado Front Range Trail/Sand
Creek Regional Greenway trail. The trail is located on the southern side of the Dahlia Trailhead parking
lot. After parking at the trailhead, one must either reach the destination by bike or walking. Once on the
trail, turn right and continue heading northwest along the concrete trail for approximately 1.3 miles. The
sampling site is located on the left within Sand Creek, where Suncor’s effluent pipe is present across the
river. Sampling occurs just downstream where effluent drains into Sand Creek. This site is located less
than 0.5 miles upstream from Sand Creek’s confluence with the South Platte River.
Eco Region: Flat to Rolling Plains
Watershed Report: Upper Middle S Platte (Waterton Cyn thru Denver)

Water Code: BRUSH CREEK - ROARING FK R, NE/Snwmss Villag
Description: From Basalt travel south on Highway 82 towards Aspen. Turn right (west) onto Brush Creek road heading towards the Town of Snowmass Village. Drive 2.5 miles to the first roundabout. At roundabout continue on Brush Creek Road for 1.5 more miles and then turn left (east) onto Owl Creek Road. Take the very next left (with a Snowmass Chapel sign) and follow road as it curves to the right and then becomes the Snowmass Chapel Parking Lot. Park and proceed to the Northeast end of the lot to find a walking path. Follow path downstream from the Chapel bridge, past a picnic table, and then turn left just before a stand of aspens. Follow a very short grassy hill down to some large boulders near the creek to sample. (Permission to sample from Rich Hooper, Grounds/Maint. for Snowmass Chapel)
Eco Region: CO Plateaus Desert Shrublands

Water Code: MEDANO CREEK, LITTLE - SAN LUIS CR, E side/Sand Dunes
Description: From south Entrance Station at Great Sand Dunes National Park, drive north 1.58 miles on main Park road to intersection of Primitive Medano Pass Rd (4WD required).  Follow this road, which will cross Medano Creek at just over 4 miles. Go another 0.16 miles to an administrative road ("Closed to Public"), which heads in a westerly direction. Park.  Follow this road on foot 0.96 miles to the crossing of the Sand Ramp Trail and Little Medano Creek -- this is the sample site.
Eco Region: S Rockies Cool and Moist Forests of the Middle to
Comments: Short Term Fire Study

Water Code: MEDANO CREEK - SAN LUIS CR, E side/Sand Dunes
Description: From south Entrance Station at Great Sand Dunes National Park, drive north 1.58 miles on main Park road to intersection of Primitive Medano Pass Rd (4WD required).  Follow this road, which will cross Medano Creek at just over 4 miles. Go another 2.05 miles, crossing the creek 3 additional times.  The sample site is the segment of the stream in the severely burned riparian area, which is west of the road about 100 feet below a beaver dam.

Comments:
Short Term Fire Study

Description: Drive south on Hwy 24 about 4.1 miles from the I-70/Hwy 24 junction, through Minturn (toward Leadville) to a point just north of the Two Elk/Eagle River confluence.  On the river side of the road are several cottonwood trees and space to park a vehicle.  This location is about 200 to 300 feet north of the effluent pipe from the Eagle Mine waste water treatment plant.

Water Code: LINCOLN CREEK - ROARING FK R #5, SE of Aspen
Description: From LC6 and the end of Lincoln Creek Rd (USFS Rd 102) head back down the road towards Grizzly Reservoir for approximately 0.2 miles where you will find mine drainage running across the road. Head up the hill, following the runoff, for a couple hundred feet and you will locate what appears to be an overflowing holding pool. This is the collection site.
Comments: NEW CPW 2021

Water Code: LINCOLN CREEK - ROARING FK R #5, SE of Aspen

About 150 feet down the road you will find another stream of mine runoff flowing across the road, the collection site is directly upstream from the road.

Description: From Meeker, take CO Hwy 13 E for 1 mi, then turn rt (E) on Rio Blanco CR 8 and follow this for 18 mi. Water Code: POUDRE RIVER #1B - I-25 to N FK POUDRE
Description: From Fort Collins go North on 14/287 to the Poudre Valley.  Head West throught the Poudre Vally past the N. Fork of the Poudre confluence with the Poudre.  Approx .5 mi past the conflunce lies the Monroe diversion on the North Side of the River (large concrete dam and diversion strcuture.)  Sample location is approx 100meters below the diversion.  A dirt pulloff  is onthe north side of the road and is marked with 4 mailboxes (3 black-1 white).  Sample location is at the River downhill from the pulloff.
Comments: TMDL Station.  7/2/14 - BS moved fr 479229/4504794 to put on water.

Water Code: POUDRE RIVER #1B - I-25 to N FK POUDRE
Description: From Fort Collins go North on 14/287 to the Poudre Valley.  Head West throught the Poudre Valley approx 5 miles to the Picnic Rock recreation area on the south side of the river.  Farther upstream there is another turnoff and recreation area called Picnic Rock.  Sampling location is at the first (south east) Picnic Rock recreation area.  Sampling site is located at teh northern edge of the parking lot on the Poudre River.
Eco Region: S Rockies Low to Middle Elevation Semi-Desert Shru
Comments:
TMDL Study.  7/2/14 - BS moved fr 481621/4501784 to put on water.
Aq. index > 200m

Water Code: THOMPSON R, LITTLE - BIG TOM R #1, S of Johnstown

Water Code: CHIEF CREEK #2 - HATCHERY DIVER DAM to HDWTRS
Description: On Route 34 heading toward Wray, turn North approx 5 miles before Wray onto Road CC.  Cross Chief Creek and head North approx 100 meters to Road 37.  Head East on 37 approx 1 mile to the first unnnamed dirt road on right and turn south.  Turn is marked by double wide trailer and large matching storage building, and white propane tank east of intersection.  Head  south 50meters to gate (unlocked) and pass through.  Head another 20meters to gate on south side and go through it (will need "E" series key or DOW guide to unlock).  Through gate approx 30 meters is headgate on Chief Creek and small pond created by the diversion.  Follow pond west beyond pond.  Sampling site is located just above fence crossing chief Creek above the pond.
Eco Region: SW Tablelands Grasslands
Comments:
AQ Index <400 Feet
TMDL Station
3/13/15 - BS moved fr WBID COSPRE06.
